meanings.definition: Lack of sense or meaning; foolishness.
meanings.sent1: The inanity of his actions left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent2: Her constant chatter about nothing in particular was pure inanity.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes were filled with inanity, making the audience burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The inanity of the situation was like trying to catch a cloud.
meanings.sent5: The inanity of the decision echoed in his mind long after it was made.

meanings.sent1: The children's inanity during recess often led to giggles from their classmates.
meanings.sent2: His inanity at the party made him the center of attention.
meanings.sent3: The inanity of the dog chasing its own tail never failed to amuse the family.
meanings.sent4: The inanity of the situation was like a clown without a circus.
meanings.sent5: The inanity of the game made it difficult to take seriously.

meanings.sent1: The inanity of the conspiracy theory was evident to all but the most gullible.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but laugh at the inanity of the situation.
